text: Midwestern Saturday Night is the self-published debut album by American singer-songwriter Susan Werner, released in 1993 (see 1993 in music). ==Track listing== All songs written by Susan Werner, except where noted #"So Heavy" – 3:35 #"Born a Little Late (The Baby Boomer Song)" – 2:55 #"Midwestern Saturday Night" – 5:21 #"I Still Believe" – 5:21 #"Rubber Glove Blues" – 2:44 #"Lullabye for One" – 4:09 #"Uncle John" – 2:32 #"The Great Out There" (Greg Simon) – 3:42 #"Maybe If I Played Cole Porter" – 4:37 #"Shadow Dancing" – 4:01 ==Personnel== *Susan Werner – guitar, piano, keyboard, vocals, background vocals Paul Gehman – upright and electric bass *Lou Abbott – percussion *Julia Haines – Celtic harp *Erik Johnson – drums ==Production== *Producer: Grant MacAvoy *Engineer: Glenn Barratt *Arrangers: Lou Abbott, Susan Werner Category:Susan Werner albums Category:1993 debut albums
title: Midwestern Saturday Night
